revised_title: Fossil Plants from Palaeozoic Rocks: Cheirostrobus, a New Type of Fossil Cone
tldr: The author examines a fossil plant, Cheirostrobus, found in the lower Carboniferous strata, and describes its unique structure and affinities to other fossil plants. Cheirostrobus has a complex structure with sporophylls that bear sporangia, and its discovery contributes to understanding the evolution of plants during the Palaeozoic era.
